meanings.definition: A person who opposes the spread of knowledge or enlightenment.
meanings.sent1: The obscurantist refused to allow new books in the library.
meanings.sent2: The obscurantist always discouraged others from seeking education.
meanings.sent3: The obscurantist's idea of a perfect world is one where no one learns anything new.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an obscurantist fortress, blocking out any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The obscurantist cast a shadow over the community, stifling curiosity and growth.

meanings.definition: Characterized by opposition to the spread of knowledge or enlightenment.
meanings.sent1: The obscurantist views on education were evident in his actions.
meanings.sent2: Her obscurantist beliefs hindered progress in the scientific community.
meanings.sent3: The obscurantist approach to learning was like trying to navigate a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: The obscurantist fog of ignorance clouded their understanding of the world.
meanings.sent5: His obscurantist mindset was a barrier to innovation and discovery.
